docs.lead_paragraph: John Harwood of CNBC and The New York Times discusses commemorations of September 11, 2001, the health care debate and other news of the week.

headline.main: MSNBC: The New York Times Edition

docs.snippet: John Harwood of CNBC and The New York Times discusses commemorations of September 11, 2001, the health care debate and other news of the week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to everyone who took part in today's EconoQuiz.
docs.abstract: Answers to our quiz on economics issues in the news, and the names of the readers who got the highest scores.
docs.snippet: Answers to our quiz on economics issues in the news, and the names of the readers who got the highest scores.

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House on Friday said it would bar illegal immigrants from purchasing health coverage through a proposed insurance marketplace. But the administration also said that the federal government would continue to require hospitals to provide emergency treatment to illegal immigrants at taxpayer expense.

headline.main: Illegal Immigrants Could Not Buy Insurance on New 'Exchange,' White House Says

docs.abstract: The White House on Friday said it would bar illegal immigrants from purchasing health coverage through a proposed insurance marketplace.
docs.snippet: The White House on Friday said it would bar illegal immigrants from purchasing health coverage through a proposed insurance marketplace.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Corn, left, of Mother Jones and James Pinkerton of Fox News debate the details of health care legislation.

headline.sub: Are Democrats afraid to pass their own bill?

docs.snippet: David Corn, left, of Mother Jones and James Pinkerton of Fox News debate the details of health care legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Victor G. Rodwin is a professor of health policy and management at the Wagner School of Public Service at New York University and co-director of the World Cities Project, International Longevity Center-USA. He teaches courses on health system comparisons and has widely published on the French health care system. He spoke with the blog contributors Sarah Arnquist and Anne Underwood.
docs.abstract: The French health care system melds universal coverage with physician freedom and a private insurance market.
docs.snippet: The French health care system melds universal coverage with physician freedom and a private insurance market.

byline.original: By ANNE UNDERWOOD and SARAH ARNQUIST

docs.lead_paragraph: Monologue | Aired Thursday night on "Late Night With Jimmy Fallon" on NBC: Everybody is talking about the big health speech last night. In his speech, President Obama said that he will not sign a health-care plan that adds one dime to the Federal deficit. And then he interrupted himself and said, "You lie!"
docs.abstract: Monologue | Aired Thursday night on "Late Night With Jimmy Fallon": Everybody is talking about the big health speech last night. In his speech, President Obama said that he will not sign a healthcare plan that adds one dime to the Federal deficit. And then he interrupted himself and said, "You lie!"
docs.snippet: Monologue | Aired Thursday night on "Late Night With Jimmy Fallon": Everybody is talking about the big health speech last night. In his speech, President Obama said that he will not sign a healthcare plan that adds one dime to the Federal deficit....

docs.lead_paragraph: The complexity of the health care care system can overwhelm even the savviest patient. That is why some families are turning to patient advocates for help, Lesley Alderman reports in today's Patient Money column.
docs.abstract: These days, even a person well versed in medical lingo can become overwhelmed by the complexity of the health care system. That is why many patients and their families who can afford it are turning to patient advocates for help.
docs.snippet: These days, even a person well versed in medical lingo can become overwhelmed by the complexity of the health care system. That is why many patients and their families who can afford it are turning to patient advocates for help.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama held a moment of silence and participates in a wreath-laying ceremony on Friday, as the nation marks the eighth anniversary of the attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon.

headline.main: The Early Word: Marking the Anniversary

docs.abstract: The president and other administration officials, as well as lawmakers, participate in ceremonies remembering Sept. 11.
docs.snippet: The president and other administration officials, as well as lawmakers, participate in ceremonies remembering Sept. 11.

docs.abstract: For Congressional Democrats, now comes the challenge of delivering on the president's promise to revamp the health care system for $900 billion without adding to the deficit.
docs.snippet: For Congressional Democrats, now comes the challenge of delivering on the president's promise to revamp the health care system for $900 billion without adding to the deficit.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama rested the credibility of his presidency on the assurance that his health plan will not add a dime to the deficit.
docs.snippet: President Obama rested the credibility of his presidency on the assurance that his health plan will not add a dime to the deficit.
